content: Hey so i'm going to start pulling together some notes for lang-team#55
I started by reviewing the Backlog Bonanza note
where I see we cited https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2967 as related work (cc @oli)
er, cc @oli

I think the summary we produced in the meeting of:

  • Review what rfc#2580 is proposing (some limited APIs that aim to maintain forward compat)
  • Review some of the things they aim to be forward compat with

is probably correct.
@oli would you like to attend the meeting? the plan is for it to take place at 2020-11-04T13:00:00-05:00
Thanks for the ping. I'll def participate
@oli want me to add you to the calendar invite?
I am writing up a hackmd with notes and would love feedback
Yes please. I'll review the hackmd tomorrow,
I reviewed the doc, changed some minor things and left some notes for the meeting

I think the major thing missing from the doc @nikomatsakis is sort of the "agenda" of the meeting in some sense -- maybe something like:

  • Summarize current state of the problem and solution space
  • Try to determine if we'd be comfortable with proposed solutions in RFC 2580 on nightly?

I'm not quite sure if that's what we're hoping for from the meeting :)

@simulacrum yes, that was roughly my plan. I had expected to talk out some of the extensions too. I see @oli added some notes and they are a few comments. I'm thinking about whether there are any key questions to pre-identify as worth spending time on

I think the main question is what the minimal useful API is that we can expose that still allows for all extensions we would like, so maybe we need to list all the possible (well, asked-for at least) extensions?
this partially exists in the doc already, but I'll build a summary list of all the features I can find
@oli yeah that'd be helpful
I did go through the "custom dst" RFC in "mild detail" in terms of vetting what interactions there would be
but I imagine a more detailed look would be good

Hey @T-lang reminder that we have a design meeting in ~25 minutes.

Here is the meeting preparation document https://hackmd.io/1Fq9TcAQRWa4_weWTe9adA
@oli do you happen to be around now?
reminder to @Simon Sapin and @oli
@T-lang design meeting starting soon
(Zulip is being very slow here for some reasonâ€¦)
Is this a video call?
@Simon Sapin whoops :) yes it is
I'll ping you the URL
(it's in the calendar invite I added you to)

Based on the discussion in the meeting, I would like to see the 'static bound dropped on Metadata before we merge, in favor of @nikomatsakis's argument that we can infer the lifetime we need when we need it.
